verbose_text: Nevertheless, despite the considerable diminution of nitrate content in amylacea leaf with saline conditions, its level seemed sufficient to maintain the NR activity in order to guarantee nitrogen assimilation; therefore, nitrate reduction process would reveal a good adaptation to salinity conditions in this ecotype, in contrast to other maize cultivars or varieties in which NR activity and growth are considerably affected at salt levels of 200 mM [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
